IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all. If you are ready to make a career out of making a difference, then you are the person for this team. As a Principal Cloud Architect you are expected to perform the following duties: Serve as the lead architect on cloud initiatives. This involves planning developing, maintaining, and reviewing cloud architecture throughout the project. Collaborate with project teams (business stakeholders, peer architecture disciplines, development/delivery teams, vendors, test/QA). Lead the cloud migration efforts Develop and maintain Cloud Architecture models, specifications, and other documentation (key written project deliverable) and/or oversee and approve such architecture documentation. Lead Proofs Of Concepts (POCs) leading to deployment of applications and infrastructures in the cloud. Depending on the specific role, design infrastructure solutions involving cloud infrastructure. Ensure solution deliveries are accurately and thoroughly reviewed as per applicable standards. Participate in and/or lead cross-functional IT Architecture groups that review designs from an enterprise perspective. Drive adherence to existing and evolving security requirements to ensure a robust and secure cloud environment. Drive adherence to application and technology standards and patterns, application portfolio strategy, and service level agreements. Partner with other project leaderships to identify and mitigate technical risks, assumptions, issues, and dependencies related to cloud architecture Influence and drive improvements to cloud architecture processes, strategies, and standards. Support pre-project efforts in terms of working with the user, IT delivery, and vendor teams, crafting conceptual solutions, and assisting with delivery time estimates. Provide technical expertise/coaching for others. Monitor architecture related to other areas of IT, business communities, and vendors to ensure the relevance of architecture to meet business needs. Provide cloud architectural leadership that supports insightful decision making, drives efficiencies in the development process, and maximizes the quality of technical deliverables. Create or review IT plans that manage clear and realistic expectations of what technology can offer in terms of products, services, and delivery mechanisms. Establish, maintain, and review enterprise models of the cloud architecture to enable applications development and decision-supporting activities, consistent with IT plans. Provide technical expertise/coaching for others. Support and mentor less experienced staff. What You Bring Bachelor’s Degree and 10 years of progressive experience in a combination of development, design in areas of cloud computing If no degree, 12 years of progressive experience as stated above Must have served for at least 5 years as a thought leader in cloud practice in Cloud Service Providers like AWS and/or Azure Must have 5 years of experience in leading migration to the cloud, cloud practice, and cloud native architectures in AWS and/or Azure Must have a solid understanding of Continuous Development and Deployment in AWS or Azure Must have at least 7 years of direct infrastructure, system, application and cloud architecture experience driving comprehensive end-to-end solutions involving AWS or Azure. Must have certifications in popular cloud providers like AWS or Azure Must be proficient in designing and maintaining cloud-based infrastructures in AWS or Azure to deliver the required performance, security, and availability requirements At least 5-7 years’ experience in AWS or Azure Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) Must haven solid hands-on experience in technologies like EC2, Lambda, S3, RDS, VPC, IAM, Cloud Watch Must have certifications in popular cloud providers like AWS and/or Azure Preferences Experience in multiple architecture disciplines is preferred. Some experience formally leading technical teams is preferred. Prefer candidates with knowledge and understanding of: Regulatory and legislative impact on health plans, specifically security requirements driven by HIPAA; Health insurance and plan administration. Experience in middleware technologies like Kafka, JBOSS and WebSphere Experience and knowledge of cloud native architectures such as Kubernetes, OpenShift, and DevSecOps. Strong leadership and mentoring skills, including team leadership and work organization/coordination. Excellent influencing and consultative skills; and the ability to proactively identify and resolve issues and opportunities. Experience working closely with the business, IT personnel and other architectural areas to provide research and development around application trends, integration patterns, vendor direction and development methodologies. Understand business behavior patterns and patterns of information and technology and how they work together to enable the business to achieve their strategic and tactical goals. Prefer a certification in at least one facet of IT architecture. It's an exciting time to work at Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina (Blue Cross NC). Health care is changing, and we're leading the way. We offer more than health insurance our customers can count on. We’re committed to better health and better health care − in our communities and beyond. Our employees bring energy and creativity to the workplace, and it shows in our innovative approach to improving the health and well-being of North Carolinians. Blue Cross NC is a fully taxed, not-for-profit North Carolina company with major operations centers in Durham and Winston-Salem. We employ more than 5,000 people who are passionate about health care, and we serve more than 4.3 million members. Help us lead the charge for better health care by joining our award-winning team. Discover tremendous opportunities with us to do challenging and rewarding work. Opportunities that can lead you to a fulfilling career, work that can help others lead healthier, happier lives.
